we should scrub all of our federal regulations to find responsible ways to make life easier for small businesses and we should offer incentives to state and local governments to do the same because that's where many of the obstacles still live

second we need to simplify tax filing and provide targeted credits and deductions for small businesses not just the big corporations that can afford the lawyers and the lobbyists defined every single loophole

third we should use technology to expand access for small businesses into new markets whether it's across town across the state across the world that's what I did in partnership with eBay in upstate New York when I was a senator we started a public private partnership to help small businesses that had never sold beyond their local community reach customers very far away
